citeinfo.origin: Indiana Geological Survey (organization responsible for data)
citeinfo.title: WATERWELLS_ILITH_IN: Water-well and Borehole Locations from Version 1.03 4-12-01 of the iLITH Database (Indiana Geological Survey, Point Shapefile)
Brown, S.E., Bleuer, N.K., O'Neal, M.A., Olejnik, Jennifer, and Rupp, Robin, 2001, 2001 Glacial-terrain Explorer: Indiana Geological Survey Open-File Study 00-08, CD-ROM.

descript.abstract: This point shapefile was created to display in a Geographic Information Systems (GIS) environment the data points that represent water wells and boreholes contained in the iLITH database. The following description of the iLITH database contains the information contained in the shapefile, taken from Open-File Study 00-08 -- "iLITH is a Microsoft Access database containing GIS capabilities that allows users to interact with a portion of the Indiana Department of Natural Resources (IDNR) Water-Well Record Database. iLITH differs from the IDNR database in that lithologic descriptions and drilling contractor names have been standardized, locational information for ~104,000 water-well logs has been verified, and the spatial information in the database has been standardized for use with USGS digital elevation data and U.S. Census Bureau Tiger data. The iLITH graphical interface facilitates efficient interaction between the user and the database."
descript.purpose: The iLITH shapefile was developed as a tool for display of the iLITH version of the IDNR water-well record database in a GIS environment. The shapefile provides a display of the entire database and can be used with ESRI ArcView 3.2 extensions that are written in Avenue and were authored by IGS personnel. Use of the extensions allows immediate display of the water well records in map form and can be used to create and display lithologic cross sections or 3-D Scenes using ESRI ArcView 3D Analyst.

timeperd.current: Acquisition date of database from IDNR, 1999.

idinfo.native: ESRI ArcView version 3.2 shapefile format. PC platform. Windows 2000 operating system. Approximately 179 Mb in size.

attracc.attraccr: The data in the iLITH database were recorded by water well drilling contractors and Indiana Department of Natural Resources (IDNR) staff. Locations of wells provided by the contractors were field checked by personnel of the IDNR. The Indiana Geological Survey verified the Indiana Department of Natural Resources locations by comparing UTM coordinates and Public Land Survey System (PLSS) descriptions. The verification process only verified that data were entered consistently, not the accuracy of the location of the wells.

dataqual.complete: Approximately 200,000 additional water well logs exist, but these were not used in the construction of the iLITH database because of incomplete or inaccurate locational and lithologic information. The shapefile contains all records contained in the version 1.03 4-12-01 of the iLITH database

horizpa.horizpar: The following discussion is from Open-File Study 00-8 of the Indiana Geological Survey -- "...the location information for each record was verified by comparing the different types of location information that are collected by the IDNR. Public Land Survey System (PLSS) descriptions were compared to Universal Transverse Mercator (UTM) coordinates. If a discrepancy greater than 1,000 feet was identified, the record was removed from the new dataset... This method is an error checking procedure and doesn't assume that either location is accurate." For the complete step-by-step procedure refer to Open-File Study 00-08, Appendix A.

vertacc.vertaccr: The vertical positional accuracy was not a factor in the digital production of Waterwells_iLITH_IN. No quantitative tests were performed.

citeinfo.title: iLITH Database, in, Brown, S.E., Bleuer, N.K., O'Neal, M.A., Olejnik, Jennifer, and Rupp, Robin, 2001, 2001 Glacial-terrain Explorer: Indiana Geological Survey Open-File Study 00-08, CD-ROM.

srctime.srccurr: Data collection date (Acquisition date of database from IDNR, 1999.)

procstep.procdesc: Creation of shapefile -- The shapefile was created using a customized IGS iLITH database extension in ESRI ArcView 3.2 by using the "create shapefile" option in the extension. The entire database was used for the shapefile.

iLITH_loc32001.shp was opened in ESRI ArcView, together with INCLP83.shp, which shows the boundary of Indiana compiled at a scale of 1:24,000. Visual inspection of iLITH_loc32001.shp showed that all 106,096 records were located within the boundary of INCLP83.shp. A copy of iLITH_loc32001.shp was created and renamed as WATERWELLS_ILITH_IN.shp to reflect that this visual inspection had been performed in lieu of clipping.

WATERWELLS_ILITH_IN.shp was opened in ESRI ArcView and its table was edited to remove the following fields -- County, Utm83_x, Utm83_y, Utm27_x, Utm27_y, Latitude, Longitude, Twnshp_n, Twnshp_d, Range_n, Range_d, Section, Quarter3, Quarter2, Quarter1, Quadrangle.

This metadata was pre-parsed and parsed using CNS (Chew and Spit, v 2.6.1) and MP (Metadata Parser, v 2.7.1) software written by Peter N. Schweitzer (United States Geological Survey). The errors generated by MP were all addressed and corrected, except that no values were assigned to "Abscissa_Resolution" and "Ordinate_Resolution."

attr.attrdef: Unique identification number for each well record in iLITH.

Number assigned to the record by the agency from which the record originated, revealed in the RECORD_SOU field in this database. The alias number for water well records from the IDNR is the IDNR unique identification number assigned to each well log at the Division of Water.
attr.attrdefs: IGS and IDNR and other state agencies and private drilling contractors.

attr.attrdef: The elevation in feet of the well head or test hole as provided on the original water well record.
The elevation of the well head or test hole site derived from the USGS 30-meter Digital Elevation Model in feet.
attr.attrdefs: IGS glacial geologists. Described in Mapping Paradigm ARN98_48.pdf, IGS Open-File Study 00-08.

attr.attrdef: The elevation of the well head or test hole site derived from the USGS 30-meter Digital Elevation Model in meters.
attr.attrdefs: IGS glacial geologists. Described in Mapping Paradigm ARN98_48.pdf, IGS Open-File Study 00-08.

attr.attrdef: The total depth in feet of described lithologic (Description) intervals. This may or may not be the same value as the "depth."
attr.attrdefs: IGS glacial geologists. Described in Mapping Paradigm ARN98_48.pdf, IGS Open-File Study 00-08.

attr.attrdef: The total drilled depth in feet of the well or test hole as described in the well record.
attr.attrdefs: IDNR, recorded by water well drilling contractors.

attr.attrdef: The depth in feet of the water level in the well measured from the land surface, top of the well head, or drilling platform. Usually measured by drilling contractor at the time of well completion.
attr.attrdefs: IDNR, recorded by water well drilling contractors.

attr.attrdef: Date the well was completed by the driller.
attr.attrdefs: IDNR, recorded by water well drilling contractors.

attr.attrdef: The address of the owner of the well.
attr.attrdefs: IDNR, recorded by water well drilling contractors.

attr.attrdef: The zip code of the owner of the well.
attr.attrdefs: IDNR, recorded by water well drilling contractors.

attr.attrdef: The name of the drilling contractor who drilled the water well or test well. The contractor names have been standardized by the IGS.
attr.attrdefs: IGS glacial geologists. Described in Mapping Paradigm ARN98_48.pdf, IGS Open-File Study 00-08.

attr.attrdef: The initials or name of the person who entered the data from the paper record or who updated the record in some way.
The original agency or source of the record.
attr.attrdefs: IGS glacial geologists. Described in Mapping Paradigm ARN98_48.pdf, IGS Open-File Study 00-08.

attr.attrdef: Date of record entry by IGS for additions of miscellaneous records for specific projects.
attr.attrdefs: IGS glacial geologists. Described in Mapping Paradigm ARN98_48.pdf, IGS Open-File Study 00-08.

attr.attrdef: Project under which the record was added to the database.
attr.attrdefs: IGS glacial geologists. Described in Mapping Paradigm ARN98_48.pdf, IGS Open-File Study 00-08.

edom.edomvd: The IDNR project was the process of entering all the IDNR water well records into a database.
edom.edomvds: IGS glacial geologists. Described in Mapping Paradigm ARN98_48.pdf, IGS Open-File Study 00-08.

edom.edomvd: The IGS_ALLEN_1997 project was the process of entering water well records the STATEMAP 1997 project in Allen County, Indiana.
edom.edomvds: IGS glacial geologists. Described in Mapping Paradigm ARN98_48.pdf, IGS Open-File Study 00-08.

edom.edomvd: The IGS_COALITION_2000 project was the process of entering new records for the Central Great Lakes Geologic Mapping Coalition project in Allen County, Indiana.
edom.edomvds: IGS glacial geologists. Described in Mapping Paradigm ARN98_48.pdf, IGS Open-File Study 00-08.

edom.edomvd: The IGS_SM_2000 project was the process of entering new records for the STATEMAP 2000 project in central Indiana.
edom.edomvds: IGS glacial geologists. Described in Mapping Paradigm ARN98_48.pdf, IGS Open-File Study 00-08.

attr.attrdef: Additional information about the location or circumstances of the well or borehole site.
attr.attrdefs: IGS glacial geologists. Described in Mapping Paradigm ARN98_48.pdf, IGS Open-File Study 00-08.

attr.attrdef: The depth of the bedrock determined by a calculation based on the lithology BEDROCK in the LITHOLOGY field of the LITHOLOGY table. There are a number of possible errors and problems associated with the identification of bedrock from the drillers' descriptions. Therefore, the actual depth to bedrock may be different than that noted in the database. Visual inspection of lithologic logs on a one-by-one basis is required to verify that BEDROCK is the logical lithology
attr.attrdefs: IGS glacial geologists. Described in Mapping Paradigm ARN98_48.pdf, IGS Open-File Study 00-08.

overview.eaover: More information is provided in the documentation that accompanies the iLITH database in IGS Open-File Study 00-08. Refer to Mapping_Paradigm.pdf in Open-File Study 00-08.

metainfo.metuc: This metadata file is intended to accompany the data set identified and received from the IGS. It should not to be altered or summarized. IGS does not support secondary distribution. If this data set was received from anyone besides the IGS, this metadata file and the data set it describes may lack integrity.
